page.title: 14Religion of Blithfield
page.content: Blithfield church is used by Church of England worshippers and is in the Lichfield diocese. The recent incumbnt has left and the new vicar is also that priest for Abbots bromley. The congreation meets once a week on Sunday and comprises an average of 25 people most of them from local farming families coming from as far afield as Kingston and Abbots Bromley. Most members are over 40 years of age. Only one family group attends regularly and even the harvest Festival is not well attended. There is an active Mothers Union but no choir or Sunday School. Two church wardens care for the church and a flower rota is used. Members of the Mothers Union clean the church. Money is raised by a garden party held annually at Lea Hall Farm and sometimes they hold a bazzaar.
